definition: unable to make sense of what one is looking at
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

sentences.english: Some practices in the China Church are difficult for people to understand.
sentences.chinese: 中国天主教会里面有一些做法让人实在看不懂。

sentences.english: Without notes, I can hardly understand ancient Chinese prose.
sentences.chinese: 注解，我根本看不懂这些白文。

sentences.english: You may not understand the videos since they are all in Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 你应该看不懂，全是中文，哈哈。

sentences.english: There are some things I really cannot read, is you're too fake, or I am silly.
sentences.chinese: 有些事我实在看不懂，是你演的太假，还是我本就傻。

sentences.english: Maggie showed me a hand-drawn map but I could make nothing of it.
sentences.chinese: 马吉给我画了张地图，但我却看不懂。

sentences.english: You'd better refer back to Chapter One if you don't understand this paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 如果你看不懂这段的意思，最好重新再看看第一章。

sentences.english: But I could not read the menu and survived on a junk food diet instead.
sentences.chinese: 可是因为我看不懂菜单，所以就买了些垃圾食物充数。

sentences.english: The book is too technical for me.
sentences.chinese: 这本书太专业了，我看不懂。

sentences.english: So the dream to disguise herself to the dreamer not understand form.
sentences.chinese: 于是梦要乔装打扮，以梦者看不懂的形式出现。

sentences.english: He was an intellectual who understood Hebrew but could not look up a train timetable correctly.
sentences.chinese: 他是懂得希伯来文，却看不懂火车时刻表的读书人。

sentences.english: In America we were confused because we couldn't read.
sentences.chinese: 在美国我们被弄糊涂了，因为我们看不懂。

sentences.english: The map was very complicated. I could not figure it out.
sentences.chinese: 那张地图太复杂，我看不懂。

sentences.english: I can't follow it without Chinese subtitles.
sentences.chinese: 没有中文字幕我看不懂。

sentences.english: There are things hin that book that I didn't know the first word about.
sentences.chinese: 那本书里有好些个事情我简直一点儿也看不懂。

sentences.english: I can't understand your English letter, so my granddaughter helped me.
sentences.chinese: 我看不懂您的英文信，所以我的孙女帮我。

definition: to understand what one is reading or watching
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
amidst the clouds and mist/(fig.) mystified/puzzled
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
although I don't understand it, it seems pretty awesome (Internet slang)
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
